title: How to use IEAnalyzeR
text: vignette demonstrates use main functions IEAnalyzeR format plot indicator time series data varying formats.
code: library(IEAnalyzeR)

what: Saving data in the proper format
title: How to use IEAnalyzeR
text: order run data data_prep function IEAnalyzeR, prepares plotting pulls relevant information, data need formatted specific way saved csv file. function convert_cleaned_data help . Every dataset needs time first column (either annual monthly) numeric values corresponding metrics remaining columns. convert_cleaned_data add metadata first 3 rows data frame data_prep use labeling. Example single metric. example annual biomass (thousand pounds) “Red fish” recorded 2000 2024. Example four metrics representing different areas. example population millions recorded annually four areas 2000 2024. Example monthly data different units. example environmental parameters temperature (°F) salinity (ppm) measured two areas monthly basis 10 years. Now datasets properly formatted metadata rows, export csvs. save files temporary location, working Gulf IEA Ecosystem Status Report, want save file formatted_csvs folder appropriate data folder depending data type.
code: head(single_metric) #>   year red_fish #> 1 2000 93.18448 #> 2 2001 94.96603 #> 3 2002 42.89116 #> 4 2003 86.43581 #> 5 2004 71.33964 #> 6 2005 61.52768  #Define header components for the data rows (ignore year) indicator_names <- c("Red fish biomass") unit_names <- c("Thousand pounds") extent_names <- c("")  # 3. Call the function single_table <- convert_cleaned_data(single_metric, indicator_names, unit_names, extent_names) head(single_table) #>   indicator Red fish biomass #> 1      unit  Thousand pounds #> 2    extent                  #> 3      2000 93.1844834797084 #> 4      2001 94.9660330638289 #> 5      2002 42.8911627829075 #> 6      2003  86.435810085386 head(annual_by_area) #>   year   Narnia Westeros  Wakanda  Arrakis #> 1 2000 47.95694 38.27504 5.911761 14.60771 #> 2 2001 47.53304 38.21399 5.855812 15.03110 #> 3 2002 48.71302 38.18572 5.368780 14.95590 #> 4 2003 47.45829 39.83290 6.379288 15.53770 #> 5 2004 48.58389 38.55412 6.008324 14.32786 #> 6 2005 48.29355 39.77159 5.968176 14.88355  #Define header components for the data rows (ignore year) indicator_names <- rep("Population", ncol(annual_by_area)-1) unit_names <- rep("Millions", ncol(annual_by_area)-1) extent_names <- c("Narnia", "Westeros", "Wakanda", "Arrakis")  # 3. Call the function multi_table <- convert_cleaned_data(annual_by_area, indicator_names, unit_names, extent_names) head(multi_table) #>   indicator       Population       Population       Population       Population #> 1      unit         Millions         Millions         Millions         Millions #> 2    extent           Narnia         Westeros          Wakanda          Arrakis #> 3      2000 47.9569377740845 38.2750355172902 5.91176089260262 14.6077055237256 #> 4      2001 47.5330411568284 38.2139893737622 5.85581202909816 15.0311023639515 #> 5      2002 48.7130214325152 38.1857187915593 5.36878002190497 14.9559015464038 #> 6      2003 47.4582929555327 39.8328979103826  6.3792876296211  15.537704449147 head(multi_unit_monthly) #>      date   temp_a salinity_a   temp_b salinity_b #> 1 2000-01 28.65922   16.31507 27.00010   19.65256 #> 2 2000-02 28.74830   19.37386 25.54092   19.06942 #> 3 2000-03 26.14456   18.50483 28.47703   15.51251 #> 4 2000-04 28.32179   15.79821 25.82020   10.75599 #> 5 2000-05 27.56698   18.21404 28.70018   10.22700 #> 6 2000-06 27.07638   11.13719 28.54701   15.13240  #Define header components for the data rows (ignore year) indicator_names <- rep("Environmental parameters", ncol(multi_unit_monthly)-1) unit_names <- c("Temperature (°F)", "Salinity (ppm)", "Temperature (°F)", "Salinity (ppm)") extent_names <- c("Area A", "Area A", "Area B", "Area B")  # 3. Call the function monthly_table <- convert_cleaned_data(multi_unit_monthly, indicator_names, unit_names, extent_names) head(monthly_table) #>   indicator Environmental parameters Environmental parameters #> 1      unit         Temperature (°F)           Salinity (ppm) #> 2    extent                   Area A                   Area A #> 3   2000-01                 28.65922                 16.31507 #> 4   2000-02                 28.74830                 19.37386 #> 5   2000-03                 26.14456                 18.50483 #> 6   2000-04                 28.32179                 15.79821 #>   Environmental parameters Environmental parameters #> 1         Temperature (°F)           Salinity (ppm) #> 2                   Area B                   Area B #> 3                 27.00010                 19.65256 #> 4                 25.54092                 19.06942 #> 5                 28.47703                 15.51251 #> 6                 25.82020                 10.75599 # Create a temporary file path for the CSV output temp_path1 <- tempfile(pattern = "single_output", fileext = ".csv") temp_path2 <- tempfile(pattern = "multi_output", fileext = ".csv") temp_path3 <- tempfile(pattern = "monthly_output", fileext = ".csv")  #Save each table to its unique temporary file path write.csv(single_table, file = temp_path1, row.names = FALSE) write.csv(multi_table, file = temp_path2, row.names = FALSE) write.csv(monthly_table, file = temp_path3, row.names = FALSE)

title: How to use IEAnalyzeR
text: data_prep function core function IEAnalyzeR. (Add text ). can simply specify file path csv within function.

title: How to use IEAnalyzeR
text: IEAnalyzeR includes standard plotting function (plot_fn_obj) plot time series data passed data prep function. trend = T argument show recent 5 year trend. Example single metric dataset:  Example multi-area data:  Example monthly data:
code: IEAnalyzeR::plot_fn_obj(final_single_data, trend = T) IEAnalyzeR::plot_fn_obj(final_multi_data, trend = T) IEAnalyzeR::plot_fn_obj(final_monthly_data, trend = T, sep_ylabs = TRUE, ylab_sublabel = c("extent", "unit"))

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: vignette demonstrates choices available plotting function IEAnalyzeR, plot_fn_obj. default figures plotted plot_fn_obj function variety data customizations. include single indicator, multi-indicator representing four regions, multi-indicator using monthly data, indicator two categories indicators..
code: library(IEAnalyzeR) # Single Indicator plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted) # Multi-Indicator plot_fn_obj(multi_data_formatted) # Multi-Monthly Indicator plot_fn_obj(monthly_data_formatted) # Two category indicator plot_fn_obj(twocat_data_formatted)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: default x-axis displays “Year”, y-axis uses “unit” variable, title uses “indicator” variable. can use manual_xlab, manual_ylab, manual_title easily customize features.
code: # Manual labels plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted,              manual_title = "Red Drum",             manual_xlab = "Time",              manual_ylab = "Pounds (thousand)")

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: argument moves facet title y-axis. intended use multi-indicators. way different y-axis labels units.
code: # Move sub-panel labels to the y-axis plot_fn_obj(multi_data_formatted, sep_ylabs = T)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: argument creates sublabel y-axis using “indicator”, “unit”, “extent” variables. default uses “indicator” main label “unit” sublabel. can choose variables used.
code: # Default to Indicator & Unit plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, ylab_sublabel = T) # Choose two variables to use as y-axis title and subtitle plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, ylab_sublabel = c("indicator", "unit"),             manual_title = NA) #> Warning: `label` cannot be a <ggplot2::element_blank> object.

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: function uses facet_wrap create multi-plots. facet_scales argument allows decide whether x y axis shared among plots remain . default scales “free”, can choose dimension allow free “free_x” “free_y”, can keep “fixed”.
code: # Fix axis scales for comparison plot_fn_obj(multi_data_formatted, facet_scales = "fixed")

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: Use ncol determine number columns multi-plot figure contain.
code: # Define number of columns plot_fn_obj(multi_data_formatted, ncol=1,             manual_title = NA,              manual_ylab = "Population (millions)") #> Warning: `label` cannot be a <ggplot2::element_blank> object.

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: feature useful two categories data dataset. look count revenue two different regions. Using facet_grid group variables unit extent, allows us align subpanels correctly use unit y-axis text.
code: plot_fn_obj(twocat_data_formatted, facet_grid = c("unit", "extent"),             manual_ylab = NA)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: Use adjust linewidth line.
code: # Change linewidth plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, lwd = 2)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: Add points figure adjust size pt_size
code: # Add points plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, pts = T, pt_size = 2)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: breaks x-axis naturally change based number data points dataset, however like define number years x-axis ticks can use xbreaks_by.
code: # Define xbreaks plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, xbreaks_by = 3)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: Figure width defines wide figure inches. Overall dimensions can saved saving figure, however using trend feature, important set fig.width intended saved dimensions trend symbols appear correct place.
code: # Define figure width plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, fig.width = 5.5)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: argument applies ggplotly() wrapper around produced plot adds interactivity figure. Useful web applications. Warning arguments may work correctly feature.
code: # Make interactive plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, interactive = T)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: Add trend symbols plot. trend last 5 years data. shade selected data. See fig.width making sure trend symbols right spot final figures.
code: # Add trends & define figure width plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted, trend = T, fig.width = 6)

title: IEAnalyzeR Plotting Customization
text: plot_fn_obj function creates ggplot object, therefore familiar plotting mechanics ggplot, can add layers plot.
code: # Load ggplot2 library(ggplot2)  # Create plot with IEAnalyzeR IEAnalyzeR_plot<-plot_fn_obj(single_data_formatted)  # Add layers using ggplot2 IEAnalyzeR_plot+   geom_vline(aes(xintercept=2010), color="blue", lwd=1.5)+   annotate("text", label="Stressor",            x=2009.25, y=88,            angle=90, size=4,            color="blue", fontface="bold")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brittany Troast. Author, maintainer. Carissa Gervasi. Author. Brendan Turley. Author. Willem Klajbor. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Troast B, Gervasi C, Turley B, Klajbor W (2026). IEAnalyzeR: Standardized Functions Gulf-IEA Ecosystem Status Reports. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {IEAnalyzeR: Standardized Functions for the Gulf-IEA Ecosystem Status Reports},   author = {Brittany Troast and Carissa Gervasi and Brendan Turley and Willem Klajbor},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: Population by area example data — annual_by_area
title: Population by area example data — annual_by_area
text: dataset containing simulated metric data package examples. example four population metrics corresponding different areas.

title: Population by area example data — annual_by_area
code: annual_by_area

title: Population by area example data — annual_by_area
text: data frame 25 rows 5 variables: year vector years. Narnia vector random numbers. Westeros vector random numbers. Wakanda vector random numbers. Arrakis vector random numbers.

title: Population by area example data — annual_by_area
text: Simulated data

what: Convert cleaned indicator dataset to indicator data format (with metadata rows) — convert_cleaned_data
title: Convert cleaned indicator dataset to indicator data format (with metadata rows) — convert_cleaned_data
text: function takes numeric data frame year column 1 metric values remaining columns combines three vectors representing different levels header metadata (indicator, unit, extent/sub-indicator). returns single data frame saved csv correct format ingestion IEAnalyzeR data_prep function.

title: Convert cleaned indicator dataset to indicator data format (with metadata rows) — convert_cleaned_data
code: convert_cleaned_data(data, indicator_names, unit_names, extent_names)

title: Convert cleaned indicator dataset to indicator data format (with metadata rows) — convert_cleaned_data
text: data data frame matrix containing numeric data . indicator_names character vector names top header row (name indicator). vector length columns excluding year column. unit_names character vector names second header row (e.g. units measurement). vector length columns excluding year column. extent_names character vector names third header row (e.g. area species names). vector length columns excluding year column.

title: Convert cleaned indicator dataset to indicator data format (with metadata rows) — convert_cleaned_data
text: data frame containing three metadata rows followed data rows can saved csv.

title: Convert cleaned indicator dataset to indicator data format (with metadata rows) — convert_cleaned_data
code: # 1. Define dummy data dat <- data.frame(   year = 2000:2004,   bio_spec1 = c(5, 10, 3, 7, 11),   bio_spec2 = c(7, 3, 8, 8, 12) )  # 2. Define header components for the data rows (ignore year) indicator_names <- c("Biomass", "Biomass") unit_names <- c("Count", "Count") extent_names <- c("species A", "species B")  # 3. Call the function final_table <- convert_cleaned_data(dat, indicator_names, unit_names, extent_names) write.csv(final_table, "Biomass_formatted.csv")

title: Title — create_metric_code_file
text: function creates file within Gulf IEA repo framework. file outlines code metric included Gulf IEA ESR's associated products. used within repo created "ESR-Report-Template".

title: Title — create_metric_code_file
code: create_metric_code_file(   metric_root_name,   format = c("R", "qmd"),   data_type = c("automated", "non-automated", "confidential"),   override = F )

title: Title — create_metric_code_file
text: metric_root_name official root name metric coded. format filetype like created code metric. R QMD files supported. data_type type accessibility data. Automated data come sources like APIs, non-automated data come manually acquiring data csvs etc., confidential data hosted anywhere publically.

title: Title — create_metric_code_file
text: file appropriate folder ESR repository coding analyzing metric executed.

what: Generate a summary table of time series indicator trends. — create_trend_table
title: Generate a summary table of time series indicator trends. — create_trend_table
text: function processes time series data, performs trend analysis, creates formatted summary table.

title: Generate a summary table of time series indicator trends. — create_trend_table
code: create_trend_table(   folder_path = "indicator_objects/objects_as_csvs/",   stmon_inds = NULL,   min_max_year = 0,   include_gt = TRUE )

title: Generate a summary table of time series indicator trends. — create_trend_table
text: folder_path character string specifying path folder. stmon_inds character vector indicator names standardized monthly anomaly calculation. min_max_year integer specifying minimum value "Max year" column filter results. include_gt logical value. TRUE, gt table returned; otherwise, data frame returned.

title: Generate a summary table of time series indicator trends. — create_trend_table
text: gt table data frame summarizing trend analysis results.

title: Generate a summary table of time series indicator trends. — create_trend_table
code: # For a real-world example, you would replace "path/to/your/data/folder" # with the actual path to your data. # # # Assuming a folder "indicator_objects/objects_as_csvs/" exists with data # # table <- create_trend_table(folder_path = "indicator_objects/objects_as_csvs/", # #                              stmon_inds = c("Carib_SST", "turbidity", "carib_Chl"), # #                              min_max_year = 2022) # # print(table)

title: Title — data_prep

title: Title — plot_fn_obj
text: function plots indicator time series figure data formated "data_prep" function IEAnalyzeR.

title: Title — plot_fn_obj
code: plot_fn_obj(   df_obj,   interactive = FALSE,   sep_ylabs = F,   ylab_sublabel = NULL,   facet_scales = "free",   ncol = NULL,   manual_ylab = NULL,   manual_xlab = NULL,   manual_title = NULL,   lwd = 0.75,   pts = F,   pt_size = 0.75,   fig.width = 6,   facet_grid = F,   xbreaks_by = NULL,   trend = F )

title: Title — plot_fn_obj
text: df_obj Data object produced "data_prep" function. interactive Run plot plotly create interactive version plot. sep_ylabs Uses facet_wrap allow subplots separate y-axis labels. works indicators one column multi. ylab_sublabel argument creates sublabel y-axis choosing two three label types. Label types include “indicator”, “unit”, “extent”. facet_scales Derived facet_wrap scales argument : scales fixed ("fixed", default), free ("free"), free one dimension ("free_x", "free_y")? controls share vs “free” axis per panel faceted plot. ncol many columns faceted figure? manual_ylab Manual y axis title. List multiple ylabs order appearance figure subindicators. manual_xlab Manual x axis title. manual_title Manual overall plot/plots title. lwd Adjust thickness timeseries line. pts T/F like points data top timeseries line. pt_size size like points graph pts=T? fig.width intended width saved figure. necessary proper spacing using trend symbol final plot whether saving function separately. facet_grid Used need subset plots organized two categories labels. T defaults unit extent, can specify two three ("indicator","unit","extent") xbreaks_by Specify interval x axis breaks occur. trend want include trend symbols (mean & slope) side plots.

title: Title — plot_fn_obj
text: plot indicatorTimeSeries format.
